C

calcr() - Method in class shapes.RegularPolygon
Calculates the radius of the inscribed circle of the polygon, where the inscribed circle is the circle that can be drawn inside the regular polygon such that it is tangent to every side of the polygon.
calcR() - Method in class shapes.RegularPolygon
Calculates the radius of the circumscribed circle of the polygon, where the circumscribed circle is the circle that intersects each vertex of the polygon.
calcVertexAngle() - Method in class shapes.RegularPolygon
Calculates the vertex angle of the polygon.
Circle - Class in shapes
This alexlewis9.shapes.Circle class represents a double precision circle that can be drawn using the Processing library.
Circle() - Constructor for class shapes.Circle
Initializes a default instance of a alexlewis9.shapes.Circle object with all dimensions set to zero.
Circle(double, double, double) - Constructor for class shapes.Circle
Initializes new instance of a alexlewis9.shapes.Circle object with given dimensions.
Circle(double, double, double, int, int, int) - Constructor for class shapes.Circle
Initializes new instance of a alexlewis9.shapes.Circle object with given dimensions and color.
Circle(double, double, double, Color) - Constructor for class shapes.Circle
Initializes new instance of a alexlewis9.shapes.Circle object with given dimensions and color.
